adjective.description: (of a person or part of the body) without clothes.
examples: he'd never seen a naked woman before

adjective.description: (of something such as feelings or behavior) undisguised; blatant.

phrases: through his telescope Galileo observed myriads of stars invisible to the naked eye
threadworm eggs are so small that they cannot be seen with the naked eye
Though invisible to the naked eye, excess calories would pile on very visible fat.
Any microscopic reduction, certainly invisible to the naked eye, is cancelled out by bulges wherever elastane cuts into flesh.
The attraction between us was almost tangible, electricity visible to the naked eye.
origin: Old English nacod, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch naakt and German nackt, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin nudus and Sanskrit nagna.
